javadoc:
Custom slider that acts as the scroll bar for the {@link FVTable}. This slider listens for
 changes to the viewport and updates its position accordingly.
 
 Q. Why not just use the standard {@link JScrollbar} that comes with the {@link JScrollPane}?  
 
 A. It's because we are viewing only a portion of the total file at any given time; if we used the
    standard scroll mechanism, it would size itself and its viewport according to that subset
 	  of the total file, while we want it to reflect the file in its entirety.
 
 Q. Why extend a JSlider for this custom scroll bar instead of a JScrollBar?  
 
 A. The JSlider is much easier to customize, specifically when trying to adjust the size of the
    slider thumb. Functionally they are both acceptable for our purposes, but the ease of using
    the slider wins out.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor. Builds the UI elements and establishes event listeners.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the value of the slider based on the given file position.
@param filePos
methods.name: setValue
methods.comment: Sets the value of the slider based on the given file position.

methods.name: setMaximum
methods.comment:
Sets the maximum slider position given the size of the file. If the file position is
 greater than the maximum size of an integer, we just set it to that maximum size.

methods.javadoc:
Updates the slider so it is in sync with the current position of the viewport. 
 
 Note that this is only done if the mouse is NOT down; if it is, it means the user is 
 moving the thumb and we should do nothing.
methods.name: syncWithViewport
methods.comment:
Updates the slider so it is in sync with the current position of the viewport. 
 
 Note that this is only done if the mouse is NOT down; if it is, it means the user is 
 moving the thumb and we should do nothing.

methods.javadoc:
Invoked when the slider value has changed. When this happens we need to update the 
 viewport to match, but ONLY if this event is triggered as a result of the user 
 manually moving the slider (and not as a result of the slider being moved programmatically
 in response to a viewport change).
methods.name: stateChanged
methods.comment:
Invoked when the slider value has changed. When this happens we need to update the 
 viewport to match, but ONLY if this event is triggered as a result of the user 
 manually moving the slider (and not as a result of the slider being moved programmatically
 in response to a viewport change).

methods.javadoc:
MOUSE EVENTS
 
 We need to set the mouseDown attribute so we only initiate a viewport
 update if the slider is moving in response to user action on the slider.
methods.name: mouseDragged
methods.comment:
MOUSE EVENTS
 
 We need to set the mouseDown attribute so we only initiate a viewport
 update if the slider is moving in response to user action on the slider.

methods.name: getFilePosition
methods.comment:
Returns the file position (long) for the given slider position (int). This is calculated by
 computing the position of the slider as a percentage of its maximum, and applying the same
 to the file position (relative to the total file size).

methods.name: getSliderPosition
methods.comment:
Returns the slider position for the given file pointer position. This is calculated by
 computing the position of the file pointer as a percentage of the total file size, and 
 applying the same to the slider (relative to its maximum value).

methods.javadoc:
Create key bindings for the slider. These are also captured by the {@link FVTable}, but if
 focus is on this slider we still want these keys to work.  
 
 We have to capture the following:
   - arrow down
   - arrow up
   - page down
   - page up
   - home
   - end
   - Ctrl-C (Command-C for mac) for copy
   - Ctrl-A (Command-A for mac) for select all
   - Shift pressed 
   - Shift released
@param table
@param model
@param reader
@param eventListener
methods.name: createKeyBindings
methods.comment:
Create key bindings for the slider. These are also captured by the FVTable, but if
 focus is on this slider we still want these keys to work.  
 
 We have to capture the following:
   - arrow down
   - arrow up
   - page down
   - page up
   - home
   - end
   - Ctrl-C (Command-C for mac) for copy
   - Ctrl-A (Command-A for mac) for select all
   - Shift pressed 
   - Shift released

name: FVSlider
comment:
Custom slider that acts as the scroll bar for the FVTable. This slider listens for
 changes to the viewport and updates its position accordingly.
 
 Q. Why not just use the standard JScrollbar that comes with the JScrollPane?  
 
 A. It's because we are viewing only a portion of the total file at any given time; if we used the
    standard scroll mechanism, it would size itself and its viewport according to that subset
 	  of the total file, while we want it to reflect the file in its entirety.
 
 Q. Why extend a JSlider for this custom scroll bar instead of a JScrollBar?

    the slider wins out.
